DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Reconstruction Surgery Type Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code for surgical procedure done to reconstruct, restore, or improve shape and appearance or function of body structures that are missing, defective, damaged, or misshapen by cancer or therapies.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgical procedure done to reconstruct, restore, or improve shape and appearance or function of body structures that are missing, defective, damaged, or misshapen by cancer or therapies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Property.preferredDefinition: Reconstruction; surgical restoration of function or form of a part.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: Surgical restoration of function or form of a part.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Surgery that is done to reshape or rebuild (reconstruct) a part of the body changed by previous surgery._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Code: See 1998 ROADS Manual for codes - RX Summ--Reconstruct 1st.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Reconstruction; surgical restoration of function or form of a part.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Surgical restoration of function or form of a part.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Subsq RX--Reconstruction Del Desdcription
ReferenceDocuments.description: Reconstructive/restorative procedures are coded here when started after the first course of therapy. Central registries currently collecting this data item should follow the 1998 ROADS Manual coding instructions. For reconstructive/restorative procedures started during the first course of therapy, see RX Summ--Reconstruct 1st [1330].  See also RX Summ--Surgery Type [1640].
